head.title: XEIKON A.D.R.'S SURGE ON FIRST DAY OF TRADING

hedline.hl1: XEIKON A.D.R.'S SURGE ON FIRST DAY OF TRADING

block.p: The American depository receipts of Xeikon N.V., a Belgian maker of digital printing systems, surged 34 percent yesterday in their first day of trading. The company, which is seeking to capture part of the short-run color printing market, sold 6.4 million A.D.R.'s at $15 each to raise $96 million. Yesterday, the shares closed at $20.125, in Nasdaq trading of almost 6.7 million shares. Each A.D.R. equals one common share. The short-run market, defined as print jobs consisting of no more than 5,000 copies, generally includes such materials as product catalogues and newsletters.
